In 1991, Ginny Burbage, a courier at FedEx, saw a package with Charles Barkley's address on it.

Her brother, Tommy Murphy, had terminal cancer. He was a big Sixers fan.

So, she sent him a letter.

Days later, Barkley came to their house. He stayed for two hours:

Jared McCain and VJ Edgecombe continue to be two peas in a pod at Summer League.

Sixers say VJ Edgecombe (thumb sprain) will be out again for this afternoon‚Äôs summer league game against Charlotte. He has been doing on-court work and his status will be updated before the Sixers‚Äô next game on Tuesday.

Quentin Grimes and the Sixers remain at a stalemate, Joel Embiid is expected to be ready for the 2025-26 season, and VJ Edgecombe expectations should be tempered a bit.

Sixers president Daryl Morey said that and more in a wide-ranging availability.

And the first half is mercifully over, with the Sixers trailing 64-35. Carter Bryant has been awesome defensively. The Sixers continue to struggle to pass.

Best-laid plans and whatnot: What should have been a fun VJ Edgecombe-Dylan Harper matchup has turned into an 18-4 Spurs lead less than four minutes into this one.
New two-way Dominick Barlow is going to start tonight for the Sixers tonight in Vegas. He just met with media here and said he wanted to play here and see how quickly he could pick things up.

Big news: The WNBA is (finally!) coming to Philly. The expansion franchise will begin play in 2030, and will be owned by Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment. 

‚ÄúPhiladelphia has long-deserved a WNBA team. And we‚Äôre proud to say that today is officially the day.
